item.title: Why Did The Mathematician Cross The Road? - with Roger Penrose
item.description:
Sir Roger Penrose is one of the biggest names in mathematics AND physics. Here he talks about sibling rivalry, Stephen Hawking, having ideas, and toilet paper.
Roger Penrose Wikipedia - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roger_Penrose
Roger Penrose books - Amazon - https://amzn.to/2XIpNBo
The Order of Merit - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Order_of_Merit
The Theory of Everything - 2014 movie about Stephen Hawking - https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2980516/
Penrose Tiling - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penrose_tiling
Penrose Toilet Paper - https://collection.sciencemuseumgroup.org.uk/objects/co439558/pack-of-four-rolls-quilted-toilet-paper-with-penrose-tiling-packaging-toilet-paper
The San Franciscos Transit Center with its Penrose Tiling - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transbay_Transit_Center#/media/File:Salesforce_Transit_Center_main_entrance.jpg
With thanks to
MSRI - https://www.msri.org
Support us on Patreon - https://www.patreon.com/numberphile
item.author: (Numberphile2)

item.title: Alcohol as a social technology to check the trustworthiness of others
item.description: Ohhh, never thought of this hypothesis: that the act of getting drunk together might be a social technology that helps us verify the trustworthiness of others by inhibiting their higher cognitive functions and thus making it harder to consciously fake things. That would make sense.

item.title: SQLite and EF Core Concurrency Tokens
item.description: Entity Framework Core has great built-in support for optimistic concurrency control. The best way to utilize this on SQL Server is via a rowversion column. Unfortunately, SQLite has no such feature. This post show how to implement similar functionality using a trigger.
